name: Jolly woolly bunting
description:
This jolly bunting is hand crocheted from Donegal tweed wool, it is a Rowan yarn that was out some years ago called 'Donegal brights', which is a bit of a misnomer if you've ever been to Donegal - lovely place but a lot greyer from my recollections! 
This bunting is 2 metres long approx (being wool it stretches a bit!) and made of pure wool. The colours are all bright - think primary, pink, red, yellow, green, blue and purple.

options.name: Wash by hand as for pure wool.

name: Seed heads
description:
This is one of my favourites, I make the felt using merino fleece and then I use free style machine embroidery to 'draw' the seed heads onto the felt. The design is inspired by wandering the moors of Penwith in the farthest south west of Cornwall throughout the seasons, I take lots of photos and make sketches of dried seed heads these are what inspire my embroidery. 
The cushion is large 14x20'', it is backed with linen fabric including a zip and stuffed with a feather pad.

options.name: This is a handmade item and care instructions must be followed fully. Returns will only be accepted under exceptional circumstances on an individual basis. Please contact me for details.

name: Daisy, Daisy
description: This cushion was inspired by our local Cornish hedgerows, these daisies can be seen throughout the summer and I love the way you can clearly see the start and finish of every petal. I have reused old linen to make this cuddly cushion, embellishing with free style machine embroidery and backing the cushion with a vintage patterned dress cotton finished with a zip. The cushion measures 16x16'' and is stuffed with a 18'' feather pad for that really lovely fullness.

options.name: This is a hand crafted item using recycled materials, care instructions must be followed fully. Returns will only be accepted in exceptional circumstances agreed on a individual basis. Please contact me for details.

name: Dresser Top
description:
Oak dresser top 110cm wide by 106cm high. This vintage dresser has been upcycled with Annie Sloan's chalk paint in two shades of grey mixed by me and protected with a top coat of wax. In the detail at the top of the dresser I have added in just a hint of pastel colours.
This dressser is solid but with obvious signs of it's past life - like us all I guess!

name: 'Play time'
description: This cushion is handmade from merino fleece, wet felted with needle felt detail and embellished with free style machine embroidery. I have been working from observations that I have taken in the form of photographs and drawings from our wonderful Cornish hedgerows with an influence of 50's design from such people as Lucienne Day and more recently Angie Lewin, their work is so inspirational. The colours for this cushion were accidentally pulled out of the fleece bag together and they reminded me of a childhood book of verse that had the most wonderful whimsical illustrations. All of this inspired this original and unique design.
